column1: full and swinging, 143kph/89mph, did that hit him on the boot?? Nigel Llong immediately turned away from the appeal, but Finch reviews, and this could be a sensational start for Australia! Definitely hit the bat, but it looks as if it crashed into the toe first - and this is stone dead, if so. Yes, boot first, that's plumb, golden duck for Malan on debut! Smashing the base of middle stump, Starc rips one out with his first ball! Boo-yah!
length ball, jumps a touch to hit Bavuma on the thigh pad, around leg stump
fullish and shaping back, flicked through backward square leg for the first SA run
length ball, straightening down the line of middle and off, de Kock is fractionally on the wrong line but gets away with a thick inside edge into his pads
fired in full, shaping back a touch on leg stump, de Kock gets in a bit of a tangle jabbing down in defence
fullish, 137kph/85mph and clipped neatly off the pads, they'll pick up a couple through
pitched up in the channel, invites the drive and Bavuma accepts, drilling four through the covers! Decent chase from the fielder but he couldn't quite time his dive to reel it in
shaping away this time, not there for the drive and Bavuma leaves it be
touch full, 134kph/83mph and skelped through extra cover once more! Not a half-volley, by any means, and some swing, too, but it shaped right into the meat of Temba's bat as he stepped out to drive
shortish, 139kph/87mph and guided down towards third man
shortish, angled across from over the wicket, left alone
back of a length outside off, de Kock is across and taps the ball down square
lopes in and wangs the ball down at 147kph/91mph, curving back and hits the leading edge as Bavuma goes across the line, squirting for one into the covers
pitched up, 142kph/88mph and tapped leg side
pinged through the covers! Some back atcha from de Kock, nicely forward and freeing the arms to send a rasping drive to the rope
full and sliding leg side, 141kph and clipped off the pads through midwicket for a couple more
pitched up, angling in with the arm, de Kock nudges towards mid-on
length, 145kph/90mph and de Kock pokes, so close to dragging on! Still a little tentative here against Starc, but gets away with this, and they scamper the single as short fine leg comes around
on the pads and worked around the corner
lovely line, dragging Bavuma out as he looks to drive on the up again, beaten past the outside edge!
fullish, angling in at 136kph/84mph and tucked towards midwicket
pitched up in the channel, Bavuma opens the face as he drives, squirted behind square where Smith leaps on it to cut off the single
fullish and whipped behind square, fine leg has to come around and they get two
tight lines and defended coming across
full and straight and whopped off the pads through midwicket, Cummins gives chase
teasing angle, rising through past the outside edge as Bavuma stays back
pitched up, 141kph/88mph and Bavuma throws the hands, misses out on a booming drive
full, not much swing now, rifled through the covers for four! Beautifully timed by Bavuma, who just leans forward into this, sends a zipping drive to the rope
drops short, 143kph/89mph and flying through outside off stump, no stroke
full and whipped off the pads, a spoonful of sugar for Temba... who is annoyed to have picked out midwicket, for no return
back of a length outside off, 137kph/85mph and guided away through backward point for one
short of a length, 143kph/89mph outside off and stabbed behind square, straight to Smith
fullish, comes across and punches to mid-off
short ball, leg side as Bavuma pulls and it sails through to Carey... Cummins went up for it, but there wasn't much support. Looks like it missed the glove
length ball sliding in to the right-hander and worked away through midwicket
shortish outside off, de Kock drops back and chops one into the ground square on the off side
length on middle and leg, 136kph/84mph and de Kock shows it a straight bat

oh Quinny... dabbles one to the keeper, South Africa's captain is gone! A respectable length ball in the channel, nothing more, but de Kock falls trying to open the face and run one behind square. Audible nick, straightforward take for Carey, Hazlewood does the business
fired in straight, length delivery and he tucks it to midwicket
in the channel, 138kph/86mph and tapped towards point as he comes across
gets too straight and he whips neatly through midwicket, timed into a gap and they'll pick up three
fullish, Bavuma comes across and punches to mid-off
back of a length, good carry as Verreynne drops the hands
length ball, sticks in the pitch a touch, spooned into the off side... but Cummins can't quite get there! That certainly seemed to hold up on the batsman
shortish and flicked square, shouts of 'catch!' again, but midwicket wasn't anywhere near getting around for it
good length on the stumps and worked through the leg side as he closes the face
shortish, 142kph/88mph outside off, defended into the off side
banged in down the leg side, Bavuma pulls and misses - but he'll have another chance, as it's called wide
dug in again, 141kph/88mph but too much bounce this time, Bavuma ignores and SA get one more to the total
pitched up at 146kph/91mph, Bavuma is timing the ball like a Swiss watchmaker today, strokes three more through the covers to finish a somewhat expensive over
shortish around off stump, Temba defends

dropped! Shanked over the on side, should be a simple take for Starc running back at mid-on, but he shells it! Coming over his shoulder but he was in position, got both hands to it, only to bar-of-soap it and give Temba a life!
on the stumps and nudged to the on side
shortish outside off and squirted behind square, not cleanly stopped and they steal one

back of a length, Vereynne pulls, <del>feather to the keeper</del> gets one off the pocket! Brilliant spot from Nigel Llong, and Hazlewood knew something was fishy even as he celebrated. No review, and rightly so
short and leg side
back of a length outside off, Verreynne taps the ball down

dragged on! Cummins strikes and this is already looking sticky for South Africa... Bavuma had been playing nicely but he's misjudged the bounce, maybe too close for the cut shot, too, and he cannons a thick bottom edge into his timbers. Off stump flat on its back, SA wobbling!
length ball, 143kph/88mph and flicked uppishly into a gap leg side to get off the mark first ball
touch back of a length outside off stump, steered towards point
shortish, 138kph and zipping through outside off, left alone
angling in at 143kph/88mph and flicked square, not far from a catching chance again - that's the SA fifty up, in the final Powerplay over
banged into the deck and Klaasen moves across to leave outside off
line and length around off stump, blocked
pitched up and driven towards mid-on, did well to dig that out
slapped through point! That was a nice bit of timing from Verreynne, picking up his first boundary
short of a length and guided to backward point
fullish length, 138kph/86mph and punched to the covers sweeper coming forwards
gets across on off stump
dug in short, Verreynne is quickly on the pull for a single through square
length on off stump, punched back down the track
142kph/88mph, more watchful stuff from Klaasen, defending back to the bowler
fullish around off stump, pace off from Cummins and it's miscued towards midwicket
short, 142kph and Klaasen jumps to angle a cross-batted chop into the turf by his feet
tight stuff from the Postman, angling back in and steered to backward point - just a single off the over
length ball, comes across and punches into a gap for one
outside off, Klaasen rocks back and steers towards point
fullish, 129kph/80mph and worked off the front pad, picks out midwicket
shortish and Klaasen sits back to lash a cut through point for one
angled in with the arm, Verreynne whips another single through midwicket
flicked through backward square leg - quiet start for MMarsh, an over in binary
over the wicket, floated up and worked for one
on the stumps, Verreynne stays in the crease and clips with the spin

flighted, skidding into the pads as Klaasen sweeps... Short liked it, but I thought it pitched outside leg. Finch, after some discussion, elects to review. Was that a googly? No, apparently the legbreak, and Hawk-Eye has it pitching just outside - umpire's call - and then spinning sharply past the wicket. So not a good review
pushed through and clipped behind square on the leg side
flattish and Verreyne punches down the ground
lobbed up, worked with the spin for another single to finish Short's opening over. Respectable
pushed through and cut off the back foot
again a touch short, Verreynne rocks back to chop through point
finds a better length, punched to extra cover coming forwards
lobs up the legbreak around off stump, driven to the infield once again
floated up on the stumps and Klaasen drives through mid-on
googly, punched down the ground
flat trajectory, nudged into the leg side
googly, not picked, steered into the covers
full on the pads, turned out to deep backward square
tossed up, full and straight, whipped out to wide long-on
drag-down, pulled round the corner but straight to short fine leg. Missed out
floated wider of the off stump, driven out to sweeper cover. 'That's nice,' purrs Carey behind the stumps
rocks back looking to play through the covers, inside edges out towards mid-on
low full toss on off stump, hacked to short midwicket via the inside half of the bat
pushed through quicker, uses the feet to get back and carve through cover
nudged out to midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped into the leg side but can't beat the diving Warner at short midwicket
fired through quicker, guided out to cover point
shimmies down, clipping out to long-on
fired through outside off, carved wide of mid-off on the back foot. Finch bumbles back and just about cuts it off, bit of a village effort but managed to flick it back in
rocks back and slashes a cut shot behind square, Starc gets round to field
slides down the leg side, poor ball from Short, Verreynne gets down early to sweep and Marsh gets round to save a run on the dive
rocks back and gets leg side of this, pressed into the covers on the back foot
drops shot, Klaasen frees his arms and flays it through midwicket for four! Rubbish ball, dispatched with aplomb. First boundary since the 11th over
length ball in the channel, guided out to point
slightly full of a length on fourth stump, pushed out to mid-off
length on leg stump, flicked away through midwicket, Short makes a good diving stop to his left
pushed uppishly towards Hazlewood at mid-off, they take on his arm and get through with relative ease
outswinger, slightly full of a length, steered into the off side
low full toss outside off, punched out to sweeper-cover
length outside off, cut out to deep cover point off the back foot
pressed out to long-on
defended towards mid-on with a full face
low full toss, forced out to long-on for a jogged single
half-volley outside off, slashed hard through extra cover for a couple
cut away to deep cover running round, the partnership moves to 49
steered out into the point region, they hare through for a sharp single to bring up the fifty stand. Good rebuilding job
full, tailing in with the angle. Dug out into the covers with minimal foot movement
full, in at the leg stump from wide on the crease. Clipped out to deep square leg, past square-leg umpire Adrian Holdstock taking evasive action!
low full toss, but he can only find mid-off in the circle
another single through the covers to bring up the 100, SA ticking over
steered down to third man on the fence. 88mph/141kph
squirted back down the pitch via the inside half of the bat looking to drive through cover
nudged to backward point
full, punched out to long-off
played out to deep midwicket on the back foot
tossed up, uses the feet and works down to long-on
full on off stump, clipped out to the right of mid-on who gets round and down to field
length in the channel, pushed to mid-off with a straight bat
length in the channel, steered down to wide third man
length outside off, looks to slug through midwicket with no foot movement and is beaten! 88mph/142kph, Cummins can't believe it didn't clip a bail!
short ball, ducks underneath it
back of a length ball, swivel-pulled straight to square leg in the ring
full and straight, clipped out to square leg elegantly. 89mph/143kph, good start to this spell from Cummins
length, hint of width, steered down to third man
fullish in the channel, forced down the ground through straight mid-on with a strong bottom hand and away for four to break the shackles!
forced out into the leg side via the inside half of the bat
back of a length, bit of a drag-down and pulled away for four more!
cutter in the channel, gets back to guide into the covers on the back foot
length on the hip, tucked out to square leg and they scamper back for a second
short outside off, drops the hands and sways inside it
fullish slower ball, wide of the off stump, mistimed towards short cover
slightly full of a length, steered into the covers
length ball on fourth stump, driven wide of mid-off for an ambled single
slower ball, yorker-length outside off, jams the bat down on it
short ball, shapes to pull, Carey goes up for the caught-behind... but Nigel Llong decides there's no bat involved. Lucky to get away without that being called wide
fullish and straight, clipped out to short midwicket
cutter on the stumps, clipped out to midwicket and they get back for a couple
back of a length, pulled out to deep square
hard length on fourth stump, can't beat mid-on
length ball, punched out into the covers
short ball, latches onto it early and pulls hard but can't beat Zampa at deep square
length in the channel, steered down to third man
back of a length, nudged out to point on the bounce and they scramble through for a quick single
length outside off, looks to hoick through midwicket but can only cue-end to the man in the ring

banged in halfway down, pulled hard but straight to Mitch Marsh at square leg in the ring who takes a sharp catch! Verreynne misses out on a debut fifty, and Cummins has 100 ODI wickets! That was the dismissal Cummins was bowling for, short ball didn't quite get up and Marsh reacted quickly to snaffle the chance
short ball to start, Miller ducks under it
length ball pushed across him, dangles the bat but can't make contact
length ball, rocks back and carves into the covers
fullish, defended into the covers and Miller makes an early call for a single
legbreak, full and straight, clipped out to deep midwicket
quick, flat legbreak, punched out to short extra cover on the back foot. Slight fumble, but no single
fullish on fifth stump, defended into the covers
low full toss on the stumps, driven out to long-off
length ball in the channel, forced out into the covers
length outside off, pulled hard in front of square, but Short gets round to his left to cut it off
slightly back of a length outside off, it sits up and Klaasen hoicks it over midwicket, a touch straight and in the air this time, over the rope after a couple of bounces
slightly full and tighter to the off stump, doesn't get up much off the pitch and flies through the gap between Klaasen's bat and pad
speared down the leg side
length in the channel, guided to Smith at point with an open face
length on off stump, pulled hard in front of square and Short gets round well again, pulling it in off the rope to save a run
tossed up on the stumps, clipped out to short midwicket
driven into the covers, can't beat the man in close
pushed through quicker towards leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
yorker length on off stump, dug out to wide long-on
flatter, but too short, and Klaasen nails this through midwicket to four to bring up an impressive fifty! Needs to keep on trucking, but has looked increasingly fluent as his innings has gone on
full and straight, defended out towards cover
clipped out to straight midwicket, race through for a single
back of a length, nudged back down the pitch
tailing yorker on off stump, looks to be crashing into the bottom of off stump but Klaasen just about digs it out, inside edging into his front boot
length ball angling in, defending back down the pitch
worked down the ground, beats the dive of mid-on inside the ring, gorgeous straight drive and Klaasen has four more!
flighted, bit of spin and it strikes the front pad with Miller propping forward... Inside edge? Umpire Holdstock not taken with the appeal
floated up on the stumps and worked to leg
full and drifting, flicked off the pads past the dive of midwicket
slightly slower, the legbreak straightens on middle and leg, clipped through square playing back
tossed up nice and slow and worked through the leg side
pushed through, Klaasen walks across and nudges another single off his pads towards short fine leg
length ball in the channel, stabbed through the covers coming forwards
full on off, 141kph/88mph and punched towards extra cover
full and shaping back in a touch, clipped off the pads through backward square
pace off from Starc, offcutter in the channel and Klaasen is a fraction early on it, chipped over cover for a couple
length ball, nibbling a touch as the batsman comes forward and defends with an open face
shortish outside off and steered through backward point from the crease
looped up wide of off stump and punched along the ground to wide long-off
flighted, sweeps hard with the spin, just a single out to deep square leg
tossed up on the stumps and worked to midwicket
worked away fine on the leg side and they will come back for a couple as the boundary rider runs around
lobbed up on leg stump and taken on the full as Miller steps out, clipped to long-on
pushed through and clipped firmly but straight to midwicket
spanked! Just a touch full and wide from Starc, and it's eased through the covers off the front foot for Miller's first boundary. Classy stuff
pitched up, 142kph/88mph and slightly tighter to off stump, can't extend the arms this time and bunts to extra cover
some tail for Starc, 142kph and scudding into the pads as Miller shuffles across... heading leg side, though
banged in short outside off, 137kph/85mph and he drops the hands
full on off, Miller is moving smoothly to whip off his front pad, picks out midwicket this time
back of a length on off and jabbed down watchfully, good finish to the over from Starc
shortish outside off and slapped through the covers
angled across from over the wicket, 131kph/81mph and tapped back on the leg side
wicket-to-wicket stuff and worked through midwicket
comes across and punches down the ground to long-on
back of a length and nudged off the hip, looked like a tight second... but Miller runs well to beat the throw from deep backward square
length ball on the stumps, Miller nudges one through mid-on
good length, worked off the legs again, they'll hustle two - that's the 50 stand between these two
edged but short of the keeper! Pitched up and drew an expansive drive, Carey went full length to his left... but it didn't quite carry. Looks like it was an offcutter, so lack of pace saved Miller
angled across and this time he drops back to steer behind point
fired in, 139kph/87mph full-bunger on off, Klaasen chops down late and direct it through mid-on for a single
steps out and thrashes this through the covers! A show of intent from Miller, who disdainfully belts Hazlewood off his length
full toss, whacked low through cover point and the man in the deep has work to do
shortish and swatted away on the pull
back of a length, Miller pokes off his hip but finds the man at midwicket prowling inside the ring
done by the slower ball, beats the bat with Miller committed... Another cutter and it gripped appreciably
pace off again, fullish length and driven down he ground to long-off
heaved over the leg side! Short-arm pick-up from Klaasen and he sends it soaring up and over the deep midwicket rope for a dismissive six!
dabbed into the covers and they scuttle through - decent over for SA, with the final Powerplay approaching
short of a length and tucked to leg
comes across and works a single around the corner
short of a length, Miller rocks back and dabs this off the face down to third man
drops short again, worked through the leg side
dug in, 139kph/87mph and Miller rolls his wrists on a pull for one
pitched full on off, 138kph and punched to long-on
bounces in and sends down a legbreak on middle and leg which is swatted to midwicket
pushed through, Klaasen is forward and swipes fine of long-on for a couple - SA raise the 200 in the 40th over
floated up, Klaasen is forward again and dinks through the covers
tossed, outside leg stump and Miller sweeps, did he get bat on it? Zampa was appealing for lbw, but that was optimistic. Runs very fine and Cummins can't cut it off, goes down as leg byes, though
comes down and swipes through mid-on
drops short, Klaasen it back in the crease and crunches a couple in front of the cover sweeper
pushed through, short outside off and Miller throws the hands, misses out as he hits the man in the ring but they pinch one
flighted, rolled out on middle stump, worked off the front pad and into a gap for two
lobbed up and clipped towards deep midwicket
gives this a bit more flight, outside off and worked against the turn for one more to the midwicket fence
flatter and tucked off the pads
drifting leg side and Miller flicks it out towards deep midwicket, they think better of trying to take on the arm
flattish legbreak, worked off leg stump to midwicket
advances, hits through the line, smooshed over long-on! An easy-breezy golf swing over the ropes, first six of the day for Miller
pushed through and he defends from the crease
tries to come down again, Zampa fires this in and he can only dig it out back to the bowler
fired through outside off, he can't get under it and Zampa fields in his follow through again
floats up the legbreak this time, worked away with the spin through midwicket
dragged down and Miller rasps a cut in front of square, brilliantly cut off by the diving Smith at extra cover. Superb work
whipped leg sided, they push hard for two... and a misfield allows them to come back for a third, raising the 100 stand between this pair!
tossed up and flicked into the leg side
shortish from Short, spinning away and cut off the back foot
punched into a gap coming forwards... again they are sniffing for a second, but won't get it this time
flighted, worked into a gap leg side, settle for one
full length and punched into the covers coming across

short ball, top-edged on the pull... flies all the way to the unguarded fence at fine leg! Probably a good thing he didn't get it where he was aiming, as deep backward square would have been in the game
slung full and wide, fading away from the right-hander, who fails to connect
hammers a length, 140kph/87mph and Klaasen jabs at it defensively
full and whipped away through the leg side
back of a length, 143kph/89mph on the stumps and nurdled into the leg side
touch full, 138kph and met with a punch wide of cover as he comes down
slower ball, full outside off and he waits for it, clips back past the bowler for two as long-on runs around
short outside off, Klaasen is up on his toes and swats through point to the sweeper

slower-ball bouncer from Cummins, Miller is forward and then has time to think about four different shots before shovelling through midwicket for one - that's fifty for Miller, at almost a run a ball. Vital knock for his side
length, stroked into a gap in the covers, Klaasen just a couple away from his own milestone
tries to come down and swipes aggressively through the line to long-on
fired full and wide, maybe a touch lucky to get away with that... kissed the tramline with Miller on his heels and swiping at thin air
length, scudding into the back leg, Starc goes up for lbw... No interest from the umpire, maybe too high. Miller was looking to swing that into next week
full and tailing away wide of the stumps, 142kph/88mph and squirted down to third man... on to 99 now, but Klaasen will want that all-important flake
short ball, loopy outside off and it completely flummoxes Miller, who looks to the square leg umpire... Starc lucky to get away with that, too
slings down a low full-toss, hammered through the covers! Miller latches on and powers it to the fence!
pitched up and clipped for one through midwicket, Miller keeps the strike
pitched up, slower ball on off stump and stroked down the ground

shortish outside off, Klaasen clips through square leg and immediately clenches his fist... Maiden ODI hundred for Heinrich Klaasen, off comes the helmet as he celebrates with his team-mate. He's red as a beet, it's been hot, hard work, but he's dug SA out of trouble with a fine knock
short ball, pace off and Miller swings hard, fails to connect
length, another cutter going away from Miller, who swipes and misses again
full ball, pace on, 139kph/87mph and Miller chops an inside edge past his stumps
smeared down the ground! Klaasen nails Cummins at last, creaming a baseball blow over long-on, picked the offcutter and got plenty of bat on it. SA still brawling
in the channel, again Miller aims to heave over the leg side and fails to connect!
back of a length, cutter from Hazlewood and Miller is defeated again, swings and misses as the ball dips past off stump
low full toss, 135kph/84mph on leg stump and glanced to short fine leg
scooped for four! Klaasen upping the tempo now, moves across early and takes it on the full, down towards fine leg
shorter, he's looking to target the same area, ramped high over short fine leg, but this one plugs in front of the rope
on the stumps and whipped into a gap leg side - again just the one boundary off the over
Miller time! At last... Picks the slower ball, smokes it down the ground! Just bounces in front of the rope, a good start to the over for SA

short ball, follows the batsman as he goes across... flapped to the keeper! Miller looking to get cute with the ramp but ends up inside-edging a simple catch to Carey! Been a bit of a struggle at the death, but still an important innings after the strife SA were in
short of a length, another offcutter and Lucky is bamboozled, dangling his bat out but can't connect

moves across, exposing all three stumps... jabbed into the leg side and Klaasen wants on, Phehlukwayo is going to be short here! Brilliant from Cummins, fielding in his follow-through to his left, turning and throwing down the stumps with the batsman nowhere!
punched through the off side, they'll come back for two
full and wide, squirted to third man! Aiming for the tramlines with a cross-seamer but Klaasen chopped it through the infield for another welcome boundary
full and wide from round the wicket, Maharaj bullocks a couple in front of the cover sweeper
144kph/89mph but fired down the leg side... and Klaasen spots the opportunity to steal the strike by running a bye, too. Smart work
jumps across, goes for the switch hit, low full toss from Starc... and Klaasen misses, but they run a bye anyway!
timber! Torpedoes off stump! Outta the ground and Maharaj is outta there... Having struck with his first ball, Starc has to wait until his 57th to pick up a second wicket with a classic yorker
full outside off, sliced towards backward point and they scamper through
full and straight and he miscues a slog, straight up over the keeper... but Carey can't get there running back! Bit of luck for Klaasen, but he's earned that today
short of a length, slower ball to finish and pulled down the ground... Anrich Nortje will scramble back to the danger end for a second, Klaasen completing a very respectable salvage job for SA
length ball, straightening on off and pushed towards extra cover. 'Wait, wait!' barks Warner
tossed up and tapped back down the track
nicely flighted, lots of overspin on off stump, Warner punches back down the track
darted on the stumps, hangs back and clips one through square
flattish outside off and swiped into the covers
darted a little quicker on the stumps and Finch can only jab to short midwicket - one off the opening over
hits a hard length to start with, Warner throws his hands at it and pierces the gap between point and third man! Brutal start
pushed into the covers, 'WAIT ON!' is the cry
length ball, bit of nip in, nudged out to cover. 88mph/142kph
slightly full of a length, steered down to third man
back of a length outside off, Finch rides the bounce and punches towards point
flays into the covers with minimal foot movement, but the fielder at short cover gets down to stop it well
flipped out into the midwicket region for one
checked inside-out punch over the covers, away for four! Finch gets motoring with an elegant loft over the infield
backs away, getting very legside of the ball, and directs it towards straight extra cover for one
clipped off the pads out to deep midwicket for an ambled single
ooft, not far away! Thick edge from Finch looking to guide it out to point off the back foot, bottom edged into de Kock's knee but he couldn't get his glove down in time to grab it
tucked out to keep the strike
bit of width, steered down to third man on the fence
slower ball on a length, nudged out to midwicket
straight length ball, Warner rocks back to swivel-pull out to the sweeper
back of a length, runs it down to third man with an open face. Warner wants to hurtle back for a second, but Finch sends him back
87mph/140kph, length ball nipping in which Finch inside-edges into his back thigh
short outside off, Finch pulls into the leg side for a single to short fine leg
length outside off, seizes on the width to force it through backward point, Shamsi gets round from third man to cut it off

no foot movement, flashes at it outside off stump, and feathers an edge behind! Finch departs early, throwing his hands at a back-of-a-length ball in the channel. Bit of extra bounce perhaps, struck the top edge as he look to flay a cross-batted shot through cover point, and the gleeful de Kock takes the catch!
cutter outside off, Smith shuffles across and works into midwicket via the inside half of the bat
outswinger on a length, thick edge from Warner looking to steer through point and it flies away for four! The man from slip had moved into the covers, and it races away to the fence
slightly full of a length, struck on the pad. Ngidi goes up convincingly, but it's definitely pitched outside the leg stump, and they decide against the review
length ball pushed across him, driven out into the covers
width outside off, Smith flays into the off side with a straight bat but can't beat the infield
length ball on fifth stump, Smith gets across to defend
half-volley outside off, squirted out to deep backward point with an open face
but Nortje's back-of-a-length ball is too straight, and Warner pulls it easy round the corner for four behind square. Deep in the crease, just rolls the wrists on it
length outside off, flashes hard at it but can't beat point with the cut shot
length on the pads, tucked out to deep midwicket
fullish and pushed across him, hacked out to mid-on via the inside half of the bat
steered down to third man for a jogged single
slightly full of a length outside off, Smith shuffles across and works through midwicket for one
slightly full of a length, flicked off the pads out to midwicket
length outside off, Smith shifts over to the off stump looking to drive through cover but Miller in close makes a superb diving stop to cut it off
yorker length on sixth stump, dug out to cover where Phehlukwayo misfields, and Smith will keep the strike. Ngidi unimpressed
hard length outside off, squeezed out into the covers
full outside off, uses the feet to wander down the track and clip to mid-on
back of a length, steered down to third man with an open face

bumper, Smith picks the length up so early and has all the time in the world to swat it behind square leg for four! Quality batting, beats short fine leg in the ring and the sweeper running round had no chance
driven out into the covers, can't beat the fielder
length on off stump, flicked out to deep midwicket for a couple
strays down the leg side, can't get bat on it
length ball pushed across him, driven straight to mid-on
full on off stump, tip-and-run out to mid-off for Warner
hard length outside off, pressed to short cover on the bounce
length ball, nudged to mid-on and Smith yelps 'NO!'
Smith shuffles across, nudging to mid-on and setting off immediately for a scurried single. Puts the fielder, Malan, under pressure, and he can't gather cleanly

chipped to the man in the covers, who takes a low catch and celebrates! Warner isn't going anywhere in a hurry... we're going upstairs, but the soft signal is out, which is so often important. Verreynne is the catcher... looks like he's jammed his fingers underneath the ball to me. These things always look worse in slow-motion. We're onto our second angle, which is completely useless, can't tell anything from here. Or from the third for that matter. I can't see that there will be conclusive evidence to the contrary of the soft signal... and Warner is given out! Slightly full of a length in the channel, pushed aerially to cover point, and Verreynne diving forward just about did the rest
nibbles away outside off stump and beats Smith's bat
length ball in the channel, fenced out to the cover fielder, Klaasen, who hurls down the stumps at the non-striker's end, but Labuschagne was always in safely
length outside off, flashed hard down to Shamsi at wide third man
slashed hard into the covers, 'WAITING' cries Marnus
short and wide, Labuschagne jumps onto the back foot and cuts hard in front of square for four!

short and wide again, driven sweetly through the covers for four more! Rocks onto the back foot, lifts the front leg while getting on top of it, and slashes it away for four. Just like a right-handed Mike Hussey
clipped down to long leg off the thigh pad
length in the channel, defended towards mid-on
length ball, guided down to third man with an open face
cutter in towards the top of leg stump, clipped down to long leg
length ball, tucked out to short midwicket
steered out to cover point, only three off the over

cutter, sliding down the leg side, clips him on the pad as he shuffles across. Phehlukwayo lets out an ambitious, vociferous appeal, but that's surely very unlikely... hang on, de Kock reviews! Looked nowhere near to me on first viewing... no bat involved, impact outside, and missing a second set! One of the worst reviews I've ever seen!
slashed down to deep backward point
cutter, worked out to square leg for one
fenced out to backward point, can't beat the fielder
cutter outside off, dabbed down to Shamsi at deep backward point
hard length outside off, dabbed down to third man for a quick couple
length ball, defended back to the bowler... Ngidi throws down the stumps but Smith had made his ground comfortably
length ball, shuffles across to clip out to deep backward square
length ball, keeps low, Laboosh tucks it out to midwicket for a couple
length outside off, carved out to deep cover
driven towards cover for another ambled single
length outside off, shapes to drive through the covers but only manages to inside edge towards midwicket. Ngidi grimaces, intriguing battle between these two
nudged into the covers, can't beat the fielder
length on fourth stump, clipped out to short midwicket where Miller flies round to field
dabbed down to deep backward point for one more
cutter, late cut down to deep backward point
short ball, strays down the leg side and Laboosh latches onto it early, swivel-pulling out to deep backward square
in the slot on off stump, flicked uppishly to mid-on on the bounce
clipped down the ground past the bowler
straightens on a length, pushed past short midwicket into the leg side for one
driven through cover for an easy single
rocks back in his crease, nudging down to long-on's right

leading edge towards short cover, but it falls just short of David Miller in close! Skipped down the track looking to work a full leg-stump ball into the leg side, strong leading edge, but didn't quite carry
full on leg stump, leading edge out towards wide gully but falls safely... Labuschagne mirroring Smith, not for the first time!
length outside off, Smith unfurls a cover drive but only manages to slash at thin air as the ball flies past the inside edge through to de Kock, much to Andile's chagrin
slower ball outside off, nudged out to mid-on
length outside off, Smith extends the arms and swings it down to square leg for a couple
length on fifth stump, pulled straight to short midwicket
full and straight, tucked off the pads down to square leg
nudged out to cover to keep the strike
pushed through on the stumps and whipped against the spin through square
tossed up, Smith drives slightly uppishly, to shouts of 'catch!' from the men close in... not close to carrying back to Maharaj
stands tall in the crease and whips down the ground
angled in from round the wicket and worked to midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, the Mighty Laboosh plays straight and clips to long-on
worked behind square, could be a tight one... but in the end Labuschagne didn't need to dive at the striker's end
shortish, 131kph/81mph and flipped to the man in the ring on the leg side
back of a length and wide of the stumps, Smith opens the face to carve behind point, half-stopped by the fielder
legcutter from Phehlukwayo, holds in the pitch and breaks away as Marnus tries to dab it off the back foot and misses
back of a length, pace on and whipped through square leg as he shuffles across
shortish and sliced through point playing back
another slower ball, the offcutter, lands this one just about on the tramlines, with Labuschagne a long way across before letting it go... but called wide
slung down short and Laboosh pulls this through backward square leg
lobbed up around off stump, punched down to long-off
bit of grip and spin, Smith's through the shot but squirts a thick outside edge through the covers for one
tossed up and worked to leg
flighted, met coming forward and tapped down the ground to long-off
nicely bowled, again it holds up and spins as Smith pushes out and miscues into the covers
tossed up and driven through the off side
lobbed up and flicked with the spin through square leg
bowling over the wicket, drops a touch short and Labuschagne rocks back to pull for one
worked with the turn around the corner, into a gap and they hustle for two, bringing up the Australia 100
pushed through quicker on the stumps, tapped square of the man at midwicket
grip and spin for Shamsi, Labuschagne flicks at it down the leg side, into the keeper's gloves... and signalled wide
tossed up nice and full, Laboosh sweeps and drags it past his stumps via an under-edge
slows his pace up, full around off stump, punched back down the track
floated up wide and driven through the covers as Smith crabs out
flatter, punched down the ground off the back foot in front of off stump
tossed up straighter, worked through mid-on
darted outside off and Labuschagne punches square coming across
driven down the ground to long-off
floated up full and Smith lashes one more through the covers
nicely flighted, slow and dipping and whipped away square on the leg side with the spin
tossed up full outside off, Smith clears the front leg... and belts it back to the bowler, Shamsi down quickly to field
flighted, straightening on leg stump, nurdled around the corner
nudged off the front pad to square leg
tossed up full and Laboosh goes for the full-blooded sweep, can't get it past backward square
very full and this time it's paddled behind square for one
flatter and straightening, gets a slight leading edge playing back
pushed through on the stumps, worked behind square
tossed up straight and driven through mid-on for a single
wheels away, prodded into the leg side
tossed up full outside off, Marnus is forward and strokes one more through long-off
flat trajectory and worked away through square leg - still no boundaries since the Powerplay for Australia
accurate stuff, worked to the leg side
flighted, on middle and leg and worked around the corner
lets go a full toss, but Smith can only bunt it limply back to the bowler
tossed up and nudged off the front pad

is that a missed stumping chance? Tough one for de Kock, skidded through low down the leg side, but he couldn't gather it cleanly! Although, to be honest, these two aren't currently hurting SA, so why bother changing things? Cunning, Quinny
lobbed up and worked with the spin behind square
drifting leg side, Laboosh flicks it behind square with a roll of the wrists and Phehlukwayo is up too quickly, has to run around
tossed up on the stumps, pushed through mid-on
slows his pace right up, Labuschagne waits on it, worked into a gap at midwicket
Smith steps out and strokes one down the ground to long-off
flicked into a gap leg side and they scamper hard to come back for two
flighted, straightening on leg stump, Labuschagne closes the bat face a touch too early
lobbed up full and whipped away through the leg side
tossed up and punched to mid-off
flighted, worked through mid-on as he comes forward
full and flighted as Smith walks down, chips deliberately back over the bowler's head, gets it very straight for a couple
floated up on leg stump and whipped to square leg
sharp spin, past Smith's inside edge, de Kock gathers down the leg side... just flicked the pad on its way through
flattish outside off and swatted through the covers
miscued, in the air but wide of the diving Maharaj! Bit of a leading edge but it squirts away down towards long-on - half-century for Smith, not looked fluent but on he goes
punched through the off side

pressure tells! Laboosh goes big, picks out long-on! SLA does the job, Maharaj tempting him into trying to hit down the ground, wasn't quite to the pitch and his shot skewed towards the man set back. Maharaj strikes, reward for a probing spell
pushed through, spinning on middle and off, Marsh defends cautiously
on the stumps, Marsh stands tall and dabs through mid-on
tossed up full and straight and tucked towards midwicket
flighted, spins as Marsh closes the face and squirts the ball to square leg
wrong'un from Shamsi, skidding on outside off as Marsh dangles the bat and taps into the covers
lobbed up and whipped down the ground for one more to long-on
slows his pace up and Marsh nearly chips to midwicket, lands just out of reach and then skedaddles into the deep for a couple
timing, Mitch... floated up on off, Marsh just presses out and strokes past mid-off for four. First boundary since the 10th over, a welcome sight for Australia
tossed up and clipped down the ground
flat outside off as Marsh goes back and stabs one more through point
tossed up and straightening on off, driven back to the bowler
drifting towards leg, Smith works inside to out through mid-off
pushed through on the stumps
stays back and punches a drive through cover point
flattish, maybe the googly and there's width outside off for Marsh to cut
flighted, rolled out on middle stump, worked through midwicket
tossed up outside off and poked into the covers
flighted, spinning sharply into the front pad... Shamsi likes it but umpire Holdstock is unmoving. Maybe doing too much to hit leg stump
tossed up around off stump, punched into the covers
floated up full around off stump, Smith bottom-hands a punch back past the bowler, despite him getting a hand on it
back of a length outside off, nibbling through as Smith chops down and fails to connect
143kph/88mph and driven through the covers, 'Yeah, couple' is the early call from Smith. He's right
squared up a touch and tapped down into the covers
shortish around off stump, Smith rides it and punches to the cover sweeper
comes across and runs this behind square on the off side
slower ball, Smith shuffles around in the crease and deflects behind square on the leg side
tossed up on the stumps and flicked with the spin
floated up full on leg, worked in front of square
clipped off the hip, Smith is running back to the danger end as deep square fields... Smith put in the dive, but he looked home and hosed
tossed up straight and nurdled through midwicket once again. Rinse and repeat
length ball, worked off the pads through square
tossed up full on off, Smith chips down the ground towards long-off
slapped over mid-off! Sounded like Smith shouted 'Oh no!' as he hit this, but he got enough on the slower ball to clear the ring and pick up only his second boundary
short and quick in the channel, sliced on the cut down towards third man
pitched up, 139kph/87mph, Marsh is across and drives to the cover sweeper
full, slower ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
fired in full, 148kph/92mph and tailing late, Smith does well to dig this out into the leg side
pitched up at 140kph and dinked towards mid-on for a scampered single. Good comeback from Nortje after the boundary first ball
pitched up outside off, bunted to cover
full toss, shanked through midwicket for four more! Poor ball and Smith dispatches it to the rope
in the channel, steered through backward point
bowled him! Top of off, just a fraction of seam movement back in and Marsh is sunk, throwing a loose punch. Third wicket for Ngidi, and South Africa are still very much in this
angled across, good length and steered down into the off side
back of a length and Carey chops down in defence

pinned on the pad, Nortje strikes and Smith is a goner! He asks Carey whether it's worth the review, but it looks fairly adjacent as Smudger trudges off! Length ball, decent bounce off the pitch. Smith was deep in the crease, looking to work through the leg side and pinned on the top of the pad. Might have been tight on height, but it's given, and that's a massive breakthrough for SA.... EDIT: Yep, ball-tracking confirms it was smashing into the top of leg stump. Good call!
defended into the covers
crunched out through extra cover for a couple to get up and running
length ball in the channel, Short slashes at it but can't get bat on it. 89mph/144kph from Nortje, who glares in D'Arcy's direction in anguish
short ball, pulled awkwardly out to midwicket for an ambled single
guided out to point, can't beat the fielder
strays down the leg side, given wide
length slid across him, driven aerially out to sweeper-cover after a couple of bounces
pushed across him, slightly straighter line and driven out to short cover
low full toss but Carey misses out, only pushing it back to the bowler on the bounce
hard length, fended into the covers where Klaasen is on it in a flash
full on off stump, dug out back down the pitch. Ngidi gathers in his follow-through and hurls it in the direction of the stumps
length ball, tucked out to short midwicket on the bounce
length ball on the stumps, swung round the corner for one down to long leg
length on fifth stump, nudged out to cover for a sharp single. Carey wants a second on the overthrow, but it's never there
slapped back down the pitch on the bounce, Associated Press gathers off his own bowling
cutter hung outside the off stump, carved out to sweeper-cover
full outside the off stump, dug out to the sweeper on the cover fence

length outside off, heaved up and over long-on, one bounce and over the rope! Short gets underway, hacked down the ground with a closed face. Not quite out the middle, but more than enough meat on it to fly away for a much-needed, pressure-relieving boundary
hard length, no width, and squeezed out to point on the bounce
hard length on off stump, steered behind point for a single
heaved back down the pitch
pushed across him, carved out to point on the bounce
slower ball, full on the stumps. Clipped out to mid-on, and they get an overthrow after Phehlukwayo hurls it in waywardly
length ball, struck back down the pitch and Ngidi gathers in his follow-through
length on the hip, tucked out to long leg
length in the channel, hacked out to cover
slower ball which grips in the surface, nudged uppishly out to long-on after a couple of bounces
back of a length ball, Carey is jumping back in the crease and pushes out into the covers
length outside off, slashed out to extra cover on the bounce
slightly full of a length on the stumps, turned out to midwicket
length ball, decent turn. Short rocks back and carves it away but can't beat cover
sits deep in the crease and thumps this out to the sweeper-cover
steered out to cover on the back foot, straight at the fielder

spooned up in the air, 'CATCH IT!' screams Shamsi, and Verreynne at long-off duly obliges! The pressure tells, Carey was horribly bogged down, unable to beat the infield. This was flat from Shamsi, with a bit of turn, and Carey decided he would take it on but could only slice it up, straight into the hands of the man on the rope!
decent turn from a length, heaved out to cover
rocks back and cuts this out to deep point to keep the strike
driven out to mid-off, straight to the fielder
slashes at a length ball outside off and can't make contact
wide yorker, Starc clears the front leg looking to flay through extra but can't connect
full outside off, squeezed out to point on the bounce and they get through for a quick single
slower-ball bouncer, waits on it and pulls to deep midwicket on the fence
inside-edged into the leg side, they squeeze through for one more

turns on a length, straight to Miller at short cover, bounces up sharply off the square and smacks him in the mouth! Think he's OK, but he's having a fiddle with a few teeth to make sure everything is in order.
yorker length, looks to go inside-out but can only loft to long-off on the bounce
yorker length, Short can only dig it out back to Shamsi
rocks onto the back foot and carves into the covers
clears the front leg looking to go over midwicket, but toe-ends it to short midwicket on the bounce

tossed up on fourth stump, toe-ended out to Miller at short cover who hurls towards the non-striker's end and it would have been out with a direct hit, but he was off-balance, and he misses by a fair few inches
offcutter in the channel, Starc doesn't pick it and is through the short early

length outside off, Starc bottom-edges through to de Kock on the bounce who throws at the base of the stumps and runs him out! Direct hit, Starc was wandering down the pitch, unaware of where the ball was and hoping for a single, and de Kock seized upon the opportunity. South Africa closing in...
length in the channel, guided to point with an open face
nagging line on fourth stump, worked to midwicket
straight and in the slot, Cummins clears the front leg and thrashes it dead-straight down the ground! Frees the arms, mooses it over mid-on with a couple of bounces before the rope
cutter outside off, hacked to short midwicket on the bounce

length ball, decent turn, Short runs down looking to slug him into next week, swipes at thin air and doesn't even bother trying to get back! Miles out of his crease, punches his bat on the walk off. De Kock gathered coolly, just about nudging the bails off with as little effort as possible, and Shamsi taps his temple as if to say 'I've got in your head, D'Arce.' Australia eight down!
struck on the pad, Shamsi belts out an appeal, Holdstock says no! No reviews left after that Phehlukwayo howler, and looked like it was sliding down regardless
strays down leg, Zampa gets down to sweep and gets plenty of bat on it
swung hard round the corner down to long leg
brings out the reverse, the cheeky devil, but can't beat the fielder at point
shifts across to the off side, and slog sweeps to deep square

pace-off outside the off stump, slogged miles up into the air, and Verreynne takes a screamer running in from long-on! Covers acres of ground coming in off the rope towards mid-on, diving forward, no doubt about the legality this time, grabbing it an inch or two off the turf, and Cummins has to trudge off. Superb from Verreynne, his third catch of the night on ODI debut
backs away, Phehlukwayo follows him, and Zampa pushes down to long-on for a single
length outside off, Hazlewood throws the kitchen sink at it but can't get bat on ball
low full toss outside off, looks to drive through the off side and flashes at thin air
cutter outside off, carved cross-batted to wide mid-off
slower ball on a length, Zampa cracks this out of the middle and it lands just short of the rope at midwicket. Awesome sound off the bat!

bursts through him, 87mph/140kph, too quick for Hazlewood backing away and it pegs back the off stump! South Africa wrap up an impressive victory, going 1-0 up in a series for the fourth time this home summer... will this be the one that they turn into a series win?
